p: Yet, Mendieta’s account goes further drawing on theoretical work from Donna Haraway; it troubles human exceptionalism from a different angle, namely the angel of non‐human technics. The human has become ‘the informatic or cyborgian, which infolds organic and technological flesh’, which melds the human to a different kind of non‐human as well. 43 As Mendieta notes, ‘We are our own domesticated animals.’ 44
